Garnish and serve. }} The '''Harvey Wallbanger''' is a [[cocktail]] made with [[vodka]], [[Galliano (liqueur)|Galliano]], and [[orange juice]]. ==History== The Harvey Wallbanger is reported to have been invented in 1952 by three-time world champion [[mixologist]] Donato 'Duke' Antone (Paolantonio). The Harvey Wallbanger was brought to international prominence by then Galliano salesman, [[George Bednar]]. Legend has it that the drink was named after a Manhattan Beach surfer who was a regular patron of Duke's 'Blackwatch' Bar on Sunset Blvd. in Hollywood during the early 1950s.{{citation needed|date=February 2013}} ==Other uses== *The [[1982 Milwaukee Brewers season|1982]] [[Milwaukee Brewers]], winners of the American League pennant, were nicknamed "Harvey's Wallbangers," because of the team's power hitting (wall banging) under mid-season manager [[Harvey Kuenn]]. After a mediocre 23–24 start to the season, manager [[Buck Rodgers]] was fired. Under Kuenn, the team went 72–43 (.626), led the Major Leagues in home runs and total bases, and produced the highest team [[On-base plus slugging#Adjusted OPS (OPS+)|OPS+]] since the {{mlby|1931}} [[New York Yankees]].<ref>Lacy, J (1967) 'Mixologist Face the World with Confidence' The Hartford Courant; Hartford CT</ref><ref>Willis, J.C. (1973) Here's Practical Guide to Mixing Drinks: Hartford Times: Hartford Connecticut</ref><ref>Ryan, B. (1972) 'An Engaging Class Knows the Latest in Libation' The Hartford Times: Hartford CT</ref><ref>Linsley, C. (1972)'25 Years of New Bartenders' Hartford Times: Hartford CT.</ref><ref>[http://cocktails.about.com/od/atozcocktailrecipes/r/hrvy_wlbngr_ckt.htm Harvey Wallbanger Cocktail Recipe]</ref> *The [[Special Air Service|SAS]] sometimes referred to [[C-4 (explosive)|C4]] explosive charges as "Harvey Wall-bangers."{{citation needed|date=February 2013}} *Harvey Wallbanger is sometimes used to refer to the [[Maze solving algorithm#Wall_follower|Wall Follower]] maze solving algorithm. *Harvey Wallbanger was the puppet character who ran the "dead-letter" post office on the Canadian children's show, [[The Hilarious House of Frightenstein]]. *The Character Sven from "Class of 77" gets constantly drunk due to his love of Harvey Wallbangers. {{citation needed|date=February 2013}} *In [[List_of_CB_slang|CB lingo]], a Harvey Wallbanger is a [[drunk driver]]; specifically, one who continually drifts across the road from one shoulder to the other and back. *Richard Pryor asks Gene Wilder about Harvey Wallbangers and then later they drink them in the movie [[See No Evil, Hear No Evil]]. *In the 1999 film [[Mystery Men]] the character Casanova Frankenstein enjoys a Harvey Wallbanger as his nemesis, Captain Amazing, arrives to apprehend him. ==References== '''Notes''' {{Reflist}} {{IBACocktails}} [[Category:Cocktails with liqueur]] [[Category:Cocktails with vodka]] [[Category:1952 introductions]]
